relative to the rates of business profits tax and the business enterprise tax.
BillAnalysis: This bill reduces the rates of the business profits tax and the business enterprise tax.

BillTitle: relative to including under the meals and rooms tax facilitators of Internet transactions of motor vehicle rentals and facilitators of Internet transactions of room occupancies.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds and modifies definitions and requirements in the meals and rooms tax to include facilitators of Internet transactions of motor vehicle rentals and facilitators of Internet transactions of room occupancies.

BillTitle: establishing the Richard "Dick" Hinch education freedom account program.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the Richard "Dick" Hinch education freedom account program.

BillTitle: apportioning state representative districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes state representative districts.

BillTitle: apportioning state senate districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes new state senate districts in accordance with the latest federal decennial census.

BillTitle: apportioning congressional districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes new United States House of Representative districts in accordance with the latest federal decennial census.

BillTitle: apportioning executive council districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes new councilor districts based on the latest federal decennial census.

BillTitle: apportioning county commissioner districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes new county commissioner districts in accordance with the latest federal decennial census.

BillTitle: apportioning delegates to state party conventions.
BillAnalysis: This bill specifies how delegates to state party conventions are to be elected in accordance with the latest federal decennial census.

BillTitle: raising the minimum age of marriage.
BillAnalysis: This bill raises the minimum age of marriage from 16 to 18 years of age.

BillTitle: relative to absentee voting and allowing for partial processing of absentee ballots prior to election day.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows no-excuse absentee voting and partial processing of absentee ballots prior to election day.

BillTitle: relative to continued in-network access to certain health care providers.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires access by a covered person to a provider in the insurer's provider directory at in-network rates for the duration of the contract for health care services.

BillTitle: relative to the reversal or forgiveness of emergency order violations.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the state shall not enforce, and shall reverse, any prior finding of violation of the governor's emergency orders regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.  The bill also provides for annulment of an arrest or criminal conviction for violation of an emergency order issued in response to COVID-19.

BillTitle: relative to renewable generation facility property subject to a voluntary payment in lieu of taxes agreement.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the exclusion of  a renewable generation facility's payments in lieu of taxes from a municipality's tax base for the education tax.

BillTitle: requiring food service establishments to establish food allergy awareness procedures.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires food service establishments to establish food allergy awareness procedures.

BillTitle: relative to the use of deadly force by a law enforcement officer.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the legal authority for a law enforcement officer to use deadly force in effecting an arrest.

BillTitle: relative to warrant articles in official ballot town, school district, or village district meetings.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that original warrant articles be placed on the official ballot at certain meetings even if such articles have been amended during the first session of the meeting.

BillTitle: relative to the definition of child abuse.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds sexual reassignment to the definition of an abused child in RSA 169-C, the child protection act.

BillTitle: relative to the display of the national motto in schools.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits school boards to provide copies of the national motto of the United States for display in each school building in the district.

BillTitle: authorizing certification for the microblading of eyebrows.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows certain persons who are not licensed for tattooing as body art practitioners to perform microblading of eyebrows.

BillTitle: relative to school district emergency special meetings.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the superior court from allowing special school meetings for specified reasons.

BillTitle: relative to ratification of amendments to the state building code and state fire code.
BillAnalysis: This bill ratifies certain amendments to the state building code and state fire code adopted by the fire marshal and state building code review board in 2015, 2016, 2019, and 2020.

BillTitle: relative to public notice requirements for certain permits issued by the department of environmental services.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires public notice using electronic means for certain permits issued by the department of environmental services.

BillTitle: relative to the Merrimack ramp toll plazas.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the commissioner of the department of transportation from adding ramp toll plazas or open road tolls in the town of Merrimack unless tolls are placed in other locations on the F.E. Everett Turnpike that have more traffic.

BillTitle: renaming and adjusting the membership of the New Hampshire commission on deafness and hearing loss.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the name of the New Hampshire commission on deafness and hearing loss to the New Hampshire commission for the deaf and hard of hearing and adds members to the commission.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: prohibiting paper billing fees.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a person from charging an additional fee for paying by mail or receiving a paper billing statement.

BillTitle: requiring town and city clerks to provide daily notification to the secretary of state of any filings for elected office.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that town and city clerks provide a daily update of candidates who have filed for nomination to the secretary of state.

BillTitle: relative to certificates of title and drivers' licenses for members of the United States foreign service.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the circumstances under which certain New Hampshire residents in the United States foreign service may apply for or renew certificates of title and drivers' licenses.

BillTitle: relative to town health officers.
relative to expenditures from the energy efficiency fund.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the public utilities commission to include school districts in the allocation of energy efficiency funds, increases the statewide allocation for energy efficiency programs, and requires rebates from the use of auction proceeds to all commercial and industrial retail energy ratepayers.

BillTitle: relative to the justified use of deadly force upon another person.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the use of deadly force in defense of another person.

BillTitle: relative to amending a conservation easement between the state and a landowner.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the amendment of a conservation easement between a governmental body and a landowner.

BillTitle: prohibiting non-disparagement clauses in settlement agreements involving a governmental unit.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits and renders unenforceable the inclusion of a non-disparagement clause in a settlement agreement involving a governmental unit.

BillTitle: declaring May 21 as Ona "Oney" Judge Day and naming the new terminal at Portsmouth international airport at Pease in her honor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes May 21 as Ona "Oney" Judge Day and names the new airport terminal at the Portsmouth international airport at Pease in her honor.

BillTitle: relative to using Atlantic Standard Time in New Hampshire.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that New Hampshire will use Atlantic Standard Time throughout the calendar year if Massachusetts and Maine also move to Atlantic Standard Time.

BillTitle: relative to voter qualifications and registration procedures.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: relative to the definition of electioneering.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends the definition of "electioneering" to remove the prohibition against wearing clothing or paraphernalia that a reasonable person would believe explicitly advocates for or against any candidate, political party, or measure being voted.

BillTitle: relative to the city of Claremont police commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the city council of Claremont shall appoint the police commission.

BillTitle: adding qualifying medical conditions to the therapeutic use of cannabis law.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds moderate to severe insomnia to the definition of "qualifying medical condition" for the purposes of the use of cannabis for therapeutic purposes law.

BillTitle: allowing alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.

BillAnalysis: This bill allows alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.

BillTitle: relative to death benefits of first responders who die from suicide.
BillAnalysis: This bill includes suicide under the definition of "killed in the line of duty" when considering eligibility for death benefits of first responders.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study best practices for companion animal groomers.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study best practices for companion animal groomers.

BillTitle: relative to human trafficking and child exploitation prevention.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the manufacture, sale, or lease of an internet-enabled device unless the device includes a filter that blocks obscene material and establishes a fee for deactivating the filter.  The bill also establishes a live adult entertainment admission fee.  Both fees would be deposited in a human trafficking and child exploitation prevention grant fund, to be administered by the attorney general.

BillTitle: relative to licensure renewal dates for certain governing boards under the office of professional licensure and certification.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the procedure and timeframe for license renewals of allied health professionals, body art practitioners, podiatrists, chiropractors, acupuncturists, and veterinarians.

BillTitle: relative to milk pasteurization.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows for the sale of products made with raw milk in certain circumstances.

BillTitle: establishing the office of school counseling and psychology, establishing the position of school counselor coordinator, and making an appropriation therefor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the office of school counseling and psychology in the division of learner support, department of education.  This bill also establishes the position of school counselor coordinator in the office of school counseling and psychology and makes an appropriation therefor.

BillTitle: modifying the dates of the state primary and associated filing deadline.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the date of the state primary election to the second Tuesday in August.

BillTitle: relative to the date of the state primary election.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the date of the state primary election to the first Tuesday in June.

BillTitle: relative to seasonal platforms on public waters of the state.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that any person seeking to anchor a floating dock, seasonal platform, inflatable platform or float on public waters of the state adhere to requirements specified by the department of safety, division of marine patrol.

BillTitle: relative to driving to the left of an unbroken painted line.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds an exemption to the prohibition on crossing unbroken painted center lines while driving on any way.

BillTitle: relative to the close of a county's books of records.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires counties to close their books 30 days following the end of the fiscal year unless  granted an extension by the commissioner of revenue administration.

BillTitle: relative to worldwide combined reporting for unitary businesses under the business profits tax.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the water's edge combined group provisions of the business profits tax.

BillTitle: establishing a dental benefit under the state Medicaid program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the commissioner of the department of health and human services to solicit information and to contract with dental managed care organizations to provide dental care to persons under the Medicaid managed care program.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the feasibility of personal rapid transit systems and unconventional public transit methods.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study whether personal rapid transit systems and unconventional public transit methods are feasible.

BillTitle: relative to political contributions made by limited liability companies.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that a political contribution by a limited liability company be allocated to members for purposes of determining whether a member has exceeded the contribution limits.

BillTitle: establishing procedures for municipal host customer-generators of electrical energy.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an exemption under net energy metering for group net metered facilities that generate electricity to offset electrical requirements of a group consisting of political subdivisions.

BillTitle: relative to the minimum hourly rate.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the state minimum hourly rate at $22.50 per hour.

BillTitle: relative to minutes and decisions in nonpublic sessions under the right-to-know law.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that for meetings in nonpublic session where the minutes or decisions were determined to not be subject to public disclosure, a list shall be kept which shall include certain information.  The list shall be made available for public disclosure.

BillTitle: relative to the referral of debts for collection.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires creditors to give affirmative notice to a consumer before bills for goods or services may be referred for collection.

BillTitle: relative to the distribution of adequate education grants.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of education to distribute adequate education grants to municipalities and requires such municipalities to transfer the grants to their school district or districts.

BillTitle: establishing a cause of action against the state to protect individual rights.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a cause of action in state court for an injury to an individual caused by an agent of the state of New Hampshire, or any of its political subdivisions, which constitutes the violation of a right under state or federal law.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the effects of deportation of primary earners on family members who are United States citizens.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study the effects of deportation of primary earners on family members who are United States citizens.

BillTitle: relative to payment for earned but unused vacation or personal time.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires an employer to pay an employee for earned but unused vacation time.

BillTitle: relative to the erection of a sound barrier in the vicinity of Teaberry Lane in the town of Bedford.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of transportation to erect a sound barrier on the F.E. Everett Turnpike in the town of Bedford.

BillTitle: relative to wake surfing.
BillAnalysis: This bill defines and regulates "wake surfing."

BillTitle: relative to personal delivery devices and mobile carriers.
BillAnalysis: This bill defines and regulates personal delivery devices and mobile carriers.

BillTitle: relative to the use of force at New Hampshire national guard facilities.
BillAnalysis: This bill specifies circumstances for the use of force at New Hampshire national guard facilities.

BillTitle: relative to the fish and game commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes changes to the fish and game commission including notice of appointment, qualifications, and misconduct and removal from office.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseFish and Game and Marine Resources

BillTitle: relative to legislative approval of the New Hampshire general court for increases in the systems benefit charge.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the requirement for legislative approval of changes to the system benefits charge to electric consumers.

BillTitle: relative to administration of psychotropic medications to children in foster care.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of health and human services to provide medication monitoring for children in foster care and to ensure that the use of medication restraint conforms with the limitations of RSA 126-U.

BillTitle: establishing an independent redistricting commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an independent redistricting commission.

BillTitle: making an appropriation to the Carroll and  Strafford counties freight rail improvements project and making an appropriation for the Coos county freight rail improvement  project.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes a capital appropriation of $2,000,000 to the department of transportation for the Carroll and Strafford freight rail improvements project.  The appropriation is contingent upon the receipt of matching private funds.

BillTitle: granting immunity from prosecution for prostitution for reporting a sexual assault.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides immunity from prosecution for prostitution for a person reporting to law enforcement that such person or another person is the victim of a sexual assault.

BillTitle: adopting the uniform real property transfer on death act.
BillAnalysis: This bill adopts the uniform real property transfer on death act.  The act provides a  mechanism for the nonprobate transfer of land, done by permitting owners of interests in real property to execute and record a transfer on death (TOD) deed.

BillTitle: relative to post-arrest photo distribution by law enforcement officers.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits law enforcement from distributing post-arrest photos of suspects except in certain circumstances.

BillTitle: relative to notice of execution of tax lien to mortgagees.
BillAnalysis: This bill extends the time for the notice of the execution of a municipal or state tax lien to be given to a mortgagee.

BillTitle: relative to placement and removal of political advertising.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the circumstances under which political advertisements may be placed on public property.

BillTitle: adding notification requirements to the weather modification statute.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires notice before a state agency attempts to modify the weather.

BillTitle: prohibiting the installation or use  of electronic tracking software.
relative to administration by the retirement system of certain health care premium deductions.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the deduction by the retirement system of a member's or beneficiary's health care premium costs as determined by the department of administrative services.

BillTitle: relative to reporting of health care associated infections.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the information that hospitals must report regarding infections.

BillTitle: relative to acreage required to build certain single family housing.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits zoning ordinances from requiring certain acreage for certain single family housing units.

BillTitle: creating a cause of action for censorship by social media websites.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private right of action by a social media website user in this state against a social media website.

BillTitle: creating a cause of action for censorship by social media websites.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private right of action by a social media website user in this state against a social media website.

BillTitle: repealing certain inactive dedicated funds.
BillAnalysis: This bill deletes certain inactive dedicated funds and adds others to the list of dedicated funds in RSA 6:12.  The bill also changes the reporting year for the office of professional licensure and certification.

BillTitle: requiring parties responsible for pollution of a drinking water supply to be financially responsible for certain consequences of that pollution.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires parties deemed responsible for pollution of a drinking water supply to be financially responsible for certain consequences of that pollution.

BillTitle: requiring schools to update documents and software to include the option of identifying a student as non-binary.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires schools to update documents and software to include the option of identifying a student as non-binary.

BillTitle: relative to the rulemaking authority of the department of information technology.
BillAnalysis: This bill exempts certain statewide standards and protocols relative to information technology, networks, telephony, and cyber security developed by the department of information technology from rulemaking under RSA 541-A.

BillTitle: allowing prisoners serving life sentences to be eligible for parole after 25 years.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires parole review of certain offenders sentenced to life without parole.

BillTitle: relative to the submission of evidence in divorce proceedings.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the parties to request a continuance if evidence in a divorce proceeding is not submitted prior to the hearing.

BillTitle: relative to private rights of action regarding pupil safety.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private right of action for bullying and cyberbullying.

BillTitle: requiring the department of environmental services to maintain a public registry of where certain fire suppressants have been used.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of environmental services to maintain a public registry of where certain fire suppressants have been used.

BillTitle: relative to causes for divorce.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the fault-based grounds for divorce.

BillTitle: relative to an electronic prescription drug program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires electronic prescribing for controlled drugs under certain circumstances.

BillAnalysis: This bill modifies the absentee ballot request forms and absentee ballot envelopes.

BillTitle: relative to physical force in defense of a person.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes certain instances where using deadly force to defend oneself or another person is not legally justifiable.

BillTitle: requiring health care providers to furnish upon request a list of ingredients contained in an injectable medication that is recommended or administered.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires health care providers to furnish upon request a list of ingredients contained in any injectable medication that is recommended or administered.

BillTitle: relative to assault against an elderly person.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a first degree assault offense for an assault against a person 65 years of age or older by a person who is more than 10 years of age older than the victim.

BillTitle: allowing increased net energy metering limits for municipal hydroelectric facilities.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the electric generating capacity of municipal hydroelectric facilities who may participate in net energy metering to 5 megawatts.

BillTitle: extending certain civil immunity to public and private entities during major public health emergencies.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes immunity from civil liability for public and private entities during a declared state of emergency due to a public health risk if the entity was acting in good faith and in accordance with public health and safety directives.

BillTitle: making a technical correction and a clarification in the law governing death benefits for emergency medical technicians and rescue squad members.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes a technical correction in the law governing death benefits for emergency medical technicians and rescue squad members.  This bill also clarifies the definition of "rescue squad member."

BillTitle: relative to changes of registration of certain voters after a primary election.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the registration of undeclared voters who register as members of a party at any primary shall be returned to undeclared registrations by the supervisors of the checklist after the close of the polls on election day.

BillTitle: relative to the apportionment of costs in cooperative school districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the apportionment formula for a cooperative school district to be subject to review 5 years after an article to continue the current formula was passed.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study universal Internet access for New Hampshire.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study universal Internet access for New Hampshire.

BillTitle: relative to community revitalization tax relief incentives.
BillAnalysis: This bill enables municipalities to offer community revitalization tax incentives for the construction of additional housing in designated areas.  The bill also revises the criteria for assistance from the affordable housing fund administered by the housing finance authority.

BillTitle: renaming Columbus Day as Indigenous People's Day.
BillAnalysis: This bill renames Columbus Day as Indigenous People's Day for the purpose of state holidays.

BillTitle: relative to posting legislative amendments on the New Hampshire legislative website.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the general court to post amendments on the general court website after they are made public or presented to a legislative committee by a member.

BillTitle: repealing the state health assessment and state health improvement plan council.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the state health improvement plan and the state health improvement plan advisory council.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to the definition of prime wetland.
BillAnalysis: This bill further defines prime wetland for local protection in fill and dredge permits.

BillTitle: relative to organizations authorized to issue decals for multi-use decal number plates.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the New Hampshire State Council of the Knights of Columbus to issue decals for multi-use plates.

BillTitle: relative to notice of rent increases in certain residential rental property.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires notice by a landlord of at least 60 days of a proposed rent increase which exceeds 5 percent or notice of at least 90 days of an increase which exceeds 8 percent.

BillTitle: relative to the calculation of child support.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the child support guideline percentages, increases the self-support reserve amount, defines a shared parenting plan, and establishes a new formula for the calculation of child support in cases involving shared parenting plans.

BillTitle: permitting tastings by liquor manufacturers at farmers' markets.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows liquor manufacturers to offer samples at farmers' markets.

BillTitle: relative to cannabis use during pregnancy.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires alternative treatment centers to prepare information regarding the risk of cannabis use during pregnancy.  The bill also requires the commissioner of the department of health and human services to prepare a brochure relative to the risk of cannabis use during pregnancy and while breastfeeding.

BillTitle: relative to the acquisition, sale, or demolition of municipal land or buildings.
relative to noncompete agreements for certain mental health professionals.
BillAnalysis: This bill mandates that certain noncompete provisions in employment contracts for pastoral psychotherapists, clinical social workers, clinical mental health counselors, and marriage and family therapists licensed by the board of mental health practice and psychologists licensed by the board of psychologists, are not enforceable.

BillTitle: relative to safety requirements for pools on foreclosed residential property.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that any pool, spa, or other water feature structure on the premises of a foreclosed residential property have an approved cover or net.

BillTitle: relative to net energy metering limits for customer generators and the purchase of output of limited electrical energy producers.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the electric generating capacity of customer generators who may participate in net energy metering and modifies the transition of tariffs applicable to certain customer-generators.  The bill clarifies the definition of eligible customer-generator for purposes of the utility property tax.  The bill also expands the authority of limited producers of electrical energy to sell its output in the private sector.

BillTitle: requiring the adoption of innovative vehicle emissions standards pursuant to section 177 of the federal Clean Air Act.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the adoption of California Low Emission/Zero Emission vehicle standards to protect public health, enable New Hampshire automotive customers to utilize the extended emissions-specific warranty, and to enable New Hampshire automotive dealers to carry Zero Emissions Vehicles in stock.  The bill also makes an appropriation to the department of environmental services to fund an additional position.

BillTitle: establishing a commission to study the removal of unused utility poles following the transition of equipment, lines, and cables to new utility poles.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a commission to study the removal of unused utility poles following the transition of equipment, lines, and cables to new utility poles.

BillTitle: commemorating the first labor strike in the United States by women.
BillAnalysis: This bill proclaims a yearly commemoration of the first labor strike in the United States by women in Dover.

BillTitle: relative to food in cigar shops.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the service but not the sale of food in cigar shops holding an on-premises cigar, beverage, and liquor license.

BillTitle: establishing greenhouse gas emission reduction goals for the state and establishing a climate action plan.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes greenhouse gas emission reduction goals for the state and authorizes the department of environmental services to inventory greenhouse gas emissions on an annual basis and to develop and report on a 5-year action plan.

BillTitle: requiring the independent investment committee of the New Hampshire retirement system to report investment fees.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the quarterly report of the retirement system's independent investment committee to include a description of investment fees.  The bill also requires independent investment committee reports to be available on the retirement system's Internet website.

BillTitle: relative to reporting a collision between a cat and a motor vehicle.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the reporting of a collision between a cat and a motor vehicle to the cat's owner or the police.

BillTitle: relative to reciprocal driver education.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the commissioner of the department of safety to issue a driver's license to any individual who can provide satisfactory evidence of completion of a course of driver education approved by the state in which the course was offered.

BillTitle: allowing beverages, wine, and mixed drinks to be sold for take out and delivery by restaurants holding an on-premises license.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows beverages, wine, and mixed drinks to be sold for take out and delivery by restaurants holding an on-premises license.

BillTitle: prohibiting the siting of a landfill near a state park.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the siting of new landfills, excluding expansions of existing landfills, near state parks.  This bill also defines state parks for the purposes of prohibiting the siting of new landfills.

BillTitle: relative to the parole of prisoners and the procedures of the adult parole board.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends various provisions of the adult parole process including the definition of violent crime and recommittal of prisoners who violate parole.

BillTitle: relative to enhanced penalties based on prior convictions for driving under the influence of drugs or liquor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an enhanced penalty for persons convicted of negligent homicide who have prior convictions for driving under the influence of drugs or liquor.

BillTitle: increasing the penalty for buyers under the law regarding trafficking in persons.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the penalty for a person who pays to engage in sexual contact with another person under the age of 18 who is a victim of human trafficking.

BillTitle: relative to the local option for operation of sports book retail locations.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows a vote for accepting operation of sports book retail locations by a city at the state primary election.

BillTitle: relative to approval of coursework completed at other approved schools
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the principal or other administrator of a high school to grant credit for courses and programs completed at other approved schools.

BillTitle: prohibiting municipalities from requiring a license for a lemonade stand operated by a person under the age of 18.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a city, town, or village district from licensing or regulating a lemonade stand operated by a person under the age of 18.

BillTitle: relative to the operation of personal water craft around the marshlands or flats of the Rye estuary and the New Castle back channel.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the operation of personal water craft within 300 feet of any marsh land or flat of the Rye estuary and the New Castle back channel.

BillTitle: removing the work requirement of the New Hampshire granite advantage health care program.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the work and community engagement requirements of the New Hampshire granite advantage health care program.

BillTitle: repealing certain inactive committees and revising the membership or duties of certain committees, councils, and boards.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals certain inactive committees and revises the membership and duties of others.

BillTitle: relative to the emergency powers of the commissioner of health and human services.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes various changes to the powers of the commissioner of the department of health and human services during a public health emergency; authorizes the joint legislative oversight committee on health and human services to review, and rescind by a 2/3 vote, emergency orders issued by the commissioner; gives a person subject to a treatment order for a communicable disease a right to a hearing on the order; and amends the membership and duties of the ethics oversight advisory committee.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to appointment of counsel in juvenile court proceedings.
BillAnalysis: This bill directs the court to appoint counsel for a minor when the juvenile delinquency petition is filed or the summons issued.  The bill also provides that a confession or statement from an unrepresented minor shall not be used in any judicial proceeding.

BillTitle: relative to accessory dwelling units.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows as a right the addition of up to 3 accessory dwelling units on a single-family dwelling.

BillTitle: relative to financial disclosures by legislators.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that the legislative ethics financial disclosure form for members and officers of the general court shall only be filed in January of the first year of the biennium.

BillTitle: relative to prior authorizations and patient transfers under managed care group health insurance policies.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds requirements for prior authorizations under managed care health benefit plans and the administration of patient transfers to another health care facility.

BillTitle: relative to pistols permitted for the taking of deer.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds additional pistols permitted for the taking of deer.

BillTitle: relative to penalties for improper timber harvesting.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that any person who negligently or recklessly causes timber to be cut on the land of another shall be guilty of trespass under RSA 227-J, relative to timber harvesting.

BillTitle: adding display of a firearm as an exception to reckless conduct.

BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private cause of action for discrimination based on hairstyles relative to a person's ethnicity.  This bill also exempts such causes of action from the jurisdiction of the human rights commission.

BillTitle: relative to the rental of shared living facilities.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the process for termination of a rental of a shared facility and the remedies for tenants.

BillTitle: relative to gold star family decals for motor vehicles.
BillAnalysis: This bill authorizes the New Hampshire office of veterans services to issue free of charge gold star family decals for motor vehicles owned by certain family members of persons killed while on duty in United States armed services.

BillTitle: relative to domicile of students for voting purposes.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the consideration of a student's educational institution as his or her place of domicile for voting purposes.

BillTitle: creating a committee to study appointing an inspector general for nursing homes in New Hampshire.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a committee to study appointing an inspector general for nursing homes in New Hampshire.

BillTitle: expanding the definition of charitable organization to include fraternal organizations for the purposes of holding raffles.
BillAnalysis: This bill expands the definition of charitable organization to include fraternal organizations for the purposes of holding raffles.

BillTitle: giving peace officer status to federal law enforcement officers.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows federal law enforcement officers to be certified by the commissioner of the department of safety for the purpose of making arrests.

BillTitle: defining animal hoarding.
BillAnalysis: This bill defines animal hoarding and sets forth a procedure for a person charged with animal hoarding to be given a psychiatric evaluation.

BillTitle: relative to animal health certificates and quarantine requirements for animals imported into the state.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes certain requirements for a dog, cat, or ferret to receive a health certificate, including a 7 day quarantine period for imported animals.

BillTitle: relative to claims for medical monitoring.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the elements of a claim for medical monitoring and the damages that may be awarded.

BillTitle: relative to the use of physical agent modalities by occupational therapists.
BillAnalysis: This bill limits the use of ultrasound and electrical physical agent modalities by occupational therapists and occupational therapy assistants.

BillTitle: relative to the election of electors of the president and vice-president of the United States.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that electors of the president and vice president of the United States shall be designated by the party that receives a plurality of votes in a plurality of executive council districts, and in the absence of such a plurality, shall be designated by the New Hampshire senate.

BillTitle: relative to proceedings of the public utilities commission on rates and charges.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that proceedings of the public utilities commission concerning rates and charges of a public utility shall be subject to the rules for contested cases under the administrative procedures act.

BillTitle: relative to enforcement of the elections laws.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits county and municipal attorneys to enforce election laws.

BillTitle: relative to state participation in low carbon fuel standards programs.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the department of environmental services from participating in discussions of any state, regional, or national low carbon fuel standards program.

BillTitle: relative to the official ballot referendum form of town meetings.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends the method of adopting official ballot referendum form of meeting.

BillTitle: allowing the destruction of valueless contraband by the chief of police.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the destruction of valueless contraband by the chief of police.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study applications of microgrids in electricity supply.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study the applications of microgrids in New Hampshire and changes in law necessary to allow for microgrids in electricity supply.

BillTitle: relative to the authority of the state fire marshal to grant an exemption from fire code requirements to recovery houses.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows substance-free recovery houses to be granted an exemption by the state fire marshal for certain requirements of the state fire code.

BillTitle: repealing the therapeutic use of cannabis advisory council.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the therapeutic use of cannabis advisory council.

BillTitle: relative to electronic notice.
BillAnalysis: This bill defines electronic notice and expressly authorizes electronic notice in lieu of newspaper publication in certain statutes that require a city, town, or other political subdivision to provide notice of a meeting, hearing or other event.

BillTitle: relative to the election of Grafton county commissioners.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the terms of the Grafton county commissioners beginning in 2022 so that one member is elected to a 4-year term at each general election.

BillTitle: relative to laboratory testing.
BillAnalysis: This bill authorizes laboratory testing without a licensed medical practitioner's order.  The bill adds rulemaking authority for the purposes of the bill.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: establishing a commission to study the utility rate structure of demand charges.
BillAnalysis: This bill  establishes a commission to study the utility rate structure of demand charges.

BillTitle: relative to the quarterly or semi-annual collection of taxes in certain municipalities.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits municipalities with semi-annual or quarterly billing to submit an adjusted rate application to the department of revenue administration in the event of an increase of 15 percent or more in the amount of property taxes to be raised for the current year as compared to the previous year.

BillTitle: prohibiting the sharing of location data.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the sharing of location data by a mobile application developer, telecommunications carrier, or other person.

BillTitle: relative to workers' compensation for heart and lung disease in firefighters.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the length of time the presumption of heart or lung disease is occupationally related for firefighters.

BillTitle: relative to the operation of certain watercraft on Wachipauka Pond.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the use of petroleum-powered powerboats and watercraft on Wachipauka Pond in Warren.

BillTitle: relative to rabies vaccinations for dogs.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes provisions for dogs that do not adequately react to a rabies vaccine.

BillTitle: relative to changing a pupil's school or assignment because of a manifest educational hardship.
relative to the establishment of a joint legislative emergency executive order oversight committee during a declared state of emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides for establishment of a joint legislative emergency executive order oversight committee upon declaration of a state of emergency.  Emergency executive orders issued by the governor during a state of emergency shall expire after 21 days unless their renewal is approved by the committee or a special session of the legislature.

BillTitle: relative to the amortization of retirement system unfunded accrued liability.
BillAnalysis: This bill extends the period for amortization of the retirement system unfunded liability as of 2017 by 5 years to 2044.  The bill requires a recertification of rates to account for the change.

BillTitle: increasing the threshold for reporting by political committees.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the dollar threshold for reporting by political committees.

BillTitle: relative to the membership of local land use boards.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that all voting members of local land use boards shall be residents of the communities in which they serve.

BillTitle: relative to the indication of blood type on drivers' licenses and nondrivers' picture identification cards.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of safety, division of motor vehicles to give holders of all drivers' licenses and nondrivers' picture identification cards the option to display their blood type on such licenses and cards.

BillTitle: establishing a commission to study the short and long term impacts of pending national and regional carbon pricing mechanisms on New Hampshire’s residents, agriculture, wildlife and natural resources-based tourism sector, and commercial enterprises.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a commission on the public health, economic, environmental and climate impacts of national and regional carbon pricing mechanisms.

BillTitle: relative to consideration of home-share income and exempting rentals of shared facilities from requirements under the real estate practice act.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: relative to credits for certain energy production not issued renewable energy certificates.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the public utilities commission to report its estimates of total yearly production for customer-sited sources that are net metered but which are not issued renewable energy certificates and removes the credit to electric providers.

BillTitle: relative to permitting fees under the shoreland protection act.
BillAnalysis: This bill exempts nonprofit organizations from permitting fees under the shoreland protection act.

BillTitle: making an appropriation to the department of environmental services for funding eligible wastewater projects.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes appropriations to the department of environmental services for the purpose of funding eligible wastewater projects under RSA 486.

BillTitle: relative to the energy consumption reduction goal.
relative to the collection of sales taxes of foreign jurisdictions by New Hampshire businesses.
BillAnalysis: This bill states that no New Hampshire business shall be required to collect sales taxes for a foreign jurisdiction unless mandated by Congress.

BillTitle: relative to the duty of school superintendents regarding criminal history records checks.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: relative to takings of property in a declared emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires a two-thirds vote of the legislature for the taking of property in a declared emergency under RSA 4:46.

BillTitle: relative to the sale of alcoholic beverages in refillable containers.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the sale of alcoholic beverages in misbranded refillable containers at the direction of the buyer.

BillTitle: relative to the perambulation of town lines.
BillAnalysis: This bill deletes the frequency provision from the requirement that selectmen perambulate the lines between the towns.

BillTitle: relative to out-of-state applicants occupational licensure or certification.
BillAnalysis: This bill modifies the procedures for out-of-state applicants for professional licensure or certification to be issued a license or certificate in this state, allows for appeals of decisions, and provides for licensure or certification based on work experience and private certification.

BillTitle: relative to the ability of the public to observe the processing and counting of absentee ballots.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that the public be permitted to observe the processing and counting of absentee ballots.

BillTitle: relative to the purchase of output of limited electrical energy producers in intrastate commerce and including qualifying storage system.
BillAnalysis: This bill expands the authority of a limited producer of electrical energy to sell its output to retail electricity customers located within the same New Hampshire electric distribution utility franchise area as the limited producer, and includes qualifying electrical energy storage.

BillTitle: relative to employment restrictions for registered sex offenders.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a person convicted of certain sexual assault offenses from hiring or otherwise engaging in any employment which provides access to a minor.

BillTitle: relative to filling certain vacancies among members of school boards and other school district offices.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that any vacancies occurring in school district offices between the beginning of the filing period and the election shall not be filled by official ballot until the following year.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the requirements of reporting by utility companies of information required for valuation of certain utility property for purposes of RSA 72.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study the requirements of reporting by utility companies of information required for valuation of certain utility property  for purposes of RSA 72.

BillTitle: establishing a commission to study the equalization rate used for the calculation of a property tax abatement by the New Hampshire board of tax and land appeals, the superior court, and all cities, towns, and counties.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a commission to study the equalization rate used for the calculation of a property tax abatement.

BillTitle: making an appropriation to the department of environmental services for the purpose of funding public water system projects.
establishing a solid waste working group on solid waste management planning and relative to compost.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a solid waste working group on solid waste management planning.

BillTitle: relative to evacuations under a state of emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the governor may recommend, but not compel, evacuation under the emergency management powers of RSA 4:45.  The bill also provides that emergency services shall not be required for those who choose not to evacuate.

BillTitle: relative to municipal estimates of expenditures and revenues.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires governing bodies to publish statements of estimated expenditures and revenues for the next fiscal year in full line item detail.

BillTitle: allowing hobby distillation of liquors.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the hobby distillation of liquors.

BillTitle: relative to the powers of the governor during a renewal of a declared state of emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill terminates a state of emergency called by the governor after 30 days and modifies the procedure for renewal.  Any orders issued during the period of a renewal of the state of emergency shall be subject to prior approval by the house of representatives.

BillTitle: relative to supreme court reporting.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes various changes to the statute governing the supreme court reporter and supreme court reports.

BillTitle: relative to assault of a campaign worker at the polling place.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an enhanced criminal penalty for assault of a campaign worker at a polling place.

BillTitle: relative to the use of funds in the drug forfeiture fund.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends the administration and distribution of funds in the drug forfeiture fund and permits such funds to be used for the establishment of substance misuse addiction, recovery, or rehabilitation centers, programs, or services.

BillTitle: relative to organ donation on a driver's license.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies that a person's decision to donate his or her own body, organ, or tissue upon death is not subject to amendment or revocation after such person's death.

BillTitle: relative to the one-half credit required course in United States and New Hampshire government and civics.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the one-half credit course in United States and New Hampshire government/civics that is required for high school graduation to be a separate and distinct course.

BillTitle: establishing a commission to study the implementation of enhanced automation of traffic lights.
establishing a commission to study ways to reduce texting while driving.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a commission to study ways to reduce texting while driving.

BillTitle: establishing the position of chief information security officer and deputy chief information security officer in the department of information technology.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the positions of chief information security officer and deputy chief information security officer in the department of information technology.

BillTitle: relative to shoreland septic systems.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires an assessment study for certain septic systems prior to the sale of certain developed waterfront properties.

BillTitle: prohibiting corporal punishment of children in state agency programs.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires state agencies to provide in their policies and procedures related to children that all forms of corporal punishment are prohibited.

BillTitle: relative to the procedures for apportioning electoral districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes procedures for apportioning electoral districts after the decennial census.

BillTitle: relative to college or university student voting.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides for in-state tuition at any institution in the university system of New Hampshire or the community college system for any person who is registered to vote in this state.  The bill also removes college or university identification cards from valid photo identification for obtaining a ballot.

BillTitle: repealing the prohibition on entering or remaining on a public way or sidewalk adjacent to a reproductive health care facility.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the prohibition on entering or remaining on a public way or sidewalk adjacent to a reproductive health care facility.

BillTitle: relative to the responsibilities of an elected animal control officer.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits selectmen to supervise the performance of elected animal control officers.

BillTitle: relative to the offenses that prevent employment in a school.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds human trafficking to the offenses that prevent a person from being hired by a school administrative unit, school district, chartered public school, or public academy.

BillTitle: limiting renewal of states of emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the governor to renew a state of emergency only once, after which time, with limited exception, it must be renewed by a concurrent resolution passed by the legislature.

BillTitle: prohibiting the use of public funds for abortions.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the use of public funds for the purpose of performing or assisting in an abortion which is not necessary to save the life of the mother.  The bill also prohibits school-based health clinics from distributing drugs classified by the FDA as "emergency contraception".

BillTitle: relative to the suspension of drivers' licenses and creating a committee to study the creation of a restricted driving license for participants in drug court.
BillAnalysis: This bill modifies the circumstances under which a driver's license may be suspended or revoked, and establishes a committee to study the creation of a restricted driving license for participants in drug court.

BillTitle: relative to eyewitness identification procedures.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds remedies for noncompliance with eyewitness identification procedures.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the implementation of the meat inspection program.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study the implementation of the meat inspection program.

BillTitle: relative to the confidentiality of animal records databases.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes provisions for the confidentiality of records made by the department of agriculture, markets, and food into any database relative to animal health certificates.

BillTitle: relative to the powers of city councils.
BillAnalysis: This bill limits the authority of city councils to make bylaws and ordinances to those they are specifically empowered to make.

BillTitle: relative to the protection of religious liberty.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the state shall not substantially burden a person’s right to the free exercise of religion unless doing so is essential to further a compelling governmental interest and is the least restrictive means of furthering that compelling governmental interest.  The bill also provides that during a state of emergency, religious organizations shall be permitted to operate under the same restrictions, if any, as providers of essential services.

BillTitle: requiring The Universal Declaration of Human Rights to be placed in all public schools.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the school board, or board of trustees of a chartered public school, to place a copy of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights in all public schools and in every classroom where civics is taught.

BillTitle: relative to penalties for a school's failure to file department of education reports.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: relative to an extended term of imprisonment for assaulting military personnel.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides for an extended term of imprisonment for an assault conviction against a member of the United States armed services.

BillTitle: relative to the board of pharmacy.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes various technical changes to the laws governing pharmacies regulated by the pharmacy board.

BillTitle: relative to competitive bidding in Carroll county.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a procedure for competitive bidding for purchases made by Carroll county.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the effects of recreational vehicles and other vehicles used in recreational activities on class 5 and 6 roads.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study the effects of recreational vehicles and vehicles used in a recreational activity on class 5 and class 6 roads.

BillTitle: relative to scuba equipment.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires a lessor of scuba equipment to also lease underwater GPS equipment.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study and compare federal Occupational Safety and Health Act standards with the safety and health standards the New Hampshire department of labor uses for public sector employees.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study and compare federal Occupational Safety and Health Act standards with the safety and health standards the New Hampshire department of labor uses for public sector employees.

BillTitle: relative to the repair of home appliances.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires home appliance manufacturers to make available to appliance owners and repair providers certain repair-related documentation, parts, and tools.  The failure to do so would be a violation of the consumer protection act.

BillTitle: relative to motor vehicle insurance policy minimums.
BillAnalysis: This bill raises the minimum amount required for motor vehicle liability insurance.

BillTitle: allowing the New Hampshire Masons to issue decals for motor vehicle plates.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the Grand Lodge of Ancient, Free and Accepted Masons in New Hampshire to issue decals for multi-use plates.

BillTitle: precluding the secretary of state from running for another office while serving as secretary of state.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the secretary of state from running for another state office while serving as secretary of state.

BillTitle: shielding journalists from mandatory disclosure of sources by subpoena.
BillAnalysis: This bill protects journalists from having to disclose their sources under subpoena.

BillTitle: relative to the requirement that certain governing bodies submit recommendations to the budget committee.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires governing bodies  to submit to the budget committee information necessary for the preparation of the annual budget in whatever detail the budget committee requires.

BillTitle: relative to the ability of a parent to enroll a child in the public school of their choice.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits pupils to attend any public school in the state and certain other states.

BillTitle: relative to the disclosure of information from vital records.
BillAnalysis: This bill grants the department of corrections authority to access a limited data set of vital records data on deaths, marriages, and divorces held by the division of vital records administration.

BillTitle: relative to the membership and duties of the legislative youth advisory council.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes changes to the membership and duties of the youth advisory council.

BillTitle: relative to provision of menstrual products for students in need.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: prohibiting a transfer of funds within an adopted budget to a general ledger line item in such budget that contains an entry of zero dollars.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a transfer of funds in an adopted budget to a general ledger line that contains zero dollars.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study cases involving the determination of parental rights and responsibilities.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study cases involving the determination of parental rights and responsibilities.

BillTitle: relative to motorcycle auxiliary lamping, and adding the New Hampshire Motorcyclists' Rights Organization to the traffic safety commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits motorcycles to have a maximum of 4 auxiliary driving lamps mounted to the front of the motorcycle.  This bill also adds a representative of the New Hampshire Motorcyclists' Rights Organization to the traffic safety commission.

BillTitle: relative to lien assessments by condominium associations.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a procedure for the enforcement of a lien assessment on a condominium unit owner by the unit owners' association.

BillTitle: requiring the Gorham town clerk to be appointed by the board of selectmen.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the town clerk in the town of Gorham be appointed by the board of selectmen.

BillTitle: relative to the commission to study school funding.
BillAnalysis: This bill deletes the requirement that the commission to study school funding remain active until the general court addresses its recommendations.

BillTitle: relative to permissible campaign contributions by business organizations and labor unions.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires business organizations and labor unions to make political contributions through segregated funds.

BillTitle: relative to contract powers of condominium unit owners' associations.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires a condominium unit owner who contracts for property management, maintenance, or improvements business with the condominium recuse himself or herself from any participation in or vote on the awarding of the contract.  Any such relationship shall be disclosed by the unit owners' association.

BillTitle: relative to current use tax rate eligibility.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that land used to harbor non-native, non-domesticated animals shall not be eligible for current use assessment under RSA 79-A.

BillTitle: relative to the definition of political advocacy organization.
BillAnalysis: This bill modifies the definition of political advocacy organization for purposes of political expenditure and contribution laws.

BillTitle: relative to the term served by a bail commissioner.
BillAnalysis: This bill decreases the length of commission of a bail commissioner.

BillTitle: relative to the designation of office on ballots.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the secretary of state to highlight the maximum number of votes a voter may cast for an office.

BillTitle: relative to police disciplinary hearings.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires police disciplinary hearings to be open to the public unless certain confidential information may be revealed.

BillTitle: relative to retroactive denials of previously paid claims.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the law regarding retroactive denials of previously paid claims under accident and health insurance.

BillTitle: establishing a renter's insurance notification requirement.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires landlords of residential rental property to include in the rental agreement a statement on the purchase of renter's insurance by the tenant.

BillTitle: prohibiting surveillance by the state on public ways or sidewalks.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the use of surveillance to determine the location of a motor vehicle or the identity or location of a pedestrian.

BillTitle: prohibiting the production of a drivers' license or nondrivers' picture identification card as a condition of conducting certain business.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits businesses from requiring production of a driver's license or nondriver's picture identification card as a condition of conducting certain transactions.

BillTitle: relative to election officers at additional polling places.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the requirement that election officials for an additional polling place in a town be domiciled in the district of the additional polling place.

BillTitle: establishing consumer protections regarding Internet service provider outages and download speeds.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes consumer protection provisions for customers of Internet service providers for service outages and less than advertised download speeds.

BillTitle: relative to treatment of PFAS contaminants in the drinking water of the Merrimack Village Water District.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires Saint Gobain Performance Plastics to pay for the remediation of water in certain wells in Merrimack that it contaminated.

BillTitle: relative to pharmacist provider status and nicotine cessation therapy.
BillAnalysis: This bill includes pharmacists as providers for certain covered services including Medicaid and   authorizes pharmacists to provide nicotine cessation therapy pursuant to a standing order from a physician or APRN and to be reimbursed under Medicaid.

BillTitle: relative to verification of ballots cast in an election.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows for public access to cast ballots.

BillTitle: establishing the office of the right-to-know ombudsman and making an appropriation therefor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes procedures to streamline the resolution of complaints under RSA 91-A.  This bill establishes the office of the right-to-know ombudsman.  This bill also establishes an alternative process to resolve right-to-know complaints.

BillTitle: relative to the use of campaign contributions for personal use expenditures.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the use of campaign contributions for certain personal uses.

BillTitle: prohibiting certain political advertising.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits political advertising that states or suggests a candidate for office would have opposed legislation from prior legislative sessions when the candidate in question has either never been a legislator or was not a legislator when such legislation was voted on.

BillTitle: relative to budget committee recommendations on warrant articles.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a budget committee from providing a recommendation next to the affected warrant article unless the warrant article includes an appropriation or expenditure.

BillTitle: requiring law enforcement officers to inform a person of their right to refuse a consensual search.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires a law enforcement officer to inform a person of their right to refuse a consensual search before conducting a consensual search.

BillTitle: relative to eligibility for the low and moderate income homeowners property tax relief.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the income and property value criteria for claimants of the low and moderate income homeowners property tax relief against statewide education property taxes.

BillTitle: establishing an information technology supply chain risk authority.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an information technology supply chain risk authority.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the benefits of allowing New Hampshire citizens to purchase health insurance from out-of-state companies.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study the benefits of allowing New Hampshire citizens to purchase health insurance from out-of-state companies.

BillTitle: prohibiting certain political contributions.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits political committees from contributing $10,000 or more to any other political committee during any election cycle.

BillTitle: permitting the use of live-action game cameras.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the use of a live-action game camera to take or attempt to take a game animal or fur bearing animal.

BillTitle: relative to over voted ballots.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that ballots that include a federal office and which contain more than the allowable number of votes for an office on the ballot be returned to the voter for possible correction before the ballot is counted.  This bill also requires the number of over voted ballots be included in the return for each election that includes a federal office.

BillTitle: requiring maintenance of the COVID-19 dashboard.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of health and human services, in collaboration with the university system of New Hampshire, to maintain the COVID-19 dashboard during the pandemic.  The bill also establishes a legislative committee to study health disparities experienced by under-represented populations during the crisis.

BillTitle: establishing a criminal penalty for an assault committed against a person who is conveying public health or safety guidance or requirements during a declared state of emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a criminal penalty for the assault of another person who is relaying public heath or safety guidance or requirements during a declared state of emergency.

BillTitle: relative to temporary relief and permanent restraining orders issued in a divorce proceeding.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the court shall not issue an order in a divorce proceeding that infringes on a party's constitutional rights unless the court determines there is no less restrictive means to achieve a compelling government interest.

BillTitle: relative to restraining orders issued in a parenting case.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the court shall not issue an order in a parenting case that infringes on a party's constitutional rights unless the court determines there is no less restrictive means to achieve a compelling government interest.

BillTitle: relative to license plate covers.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits persons from attaching or permitting to be attached to a license plate any coverings that are colored, smoked, or tinted.

BillTitle: allowing a school district to exempt its chief administrative officer from compulsory participation in the retirement system.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows a school district to have its superintendent not be required to be a member of the state retirement system and by contract to provide for an equivalent payment to such superintendent for contribution in private retirement accounts.

BillTitle: relative to the appointment of bail commissioners.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a bail commissioners board in each county to appoint bail commissioners who shall be qualified to serve as bail commissioners statewide.  The bill also requires the court to pay the bail commissioner's fee in cases where a defendant claims, but is not proven to be indigent.

BillTitle: prohibiting the state from using a face recognition system.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the state from using face recognition technology.

BillTitle: relative to reducing school food waste and addressing child hunger.
establishing a minimum pay rate for adjunct faculty of the university system of New Hampshire and community college system of New Hampshire.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a minimum pay rate for adjunct faculty of the university system of New Hampshire and community college system of New Hampshire.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study whether adequate funds are being set aside from the tobacco fund for youth and young adult prevention to help preserve long-term health.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study whether adequate funds are being set aside from the tobacco fund for youth and young adult prevention to help preserve long-term health.

BillTitle: establishing a New Hampshire commission on homelessness.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the New Hampshire commission on homelessness.

BillTitle: relative to the state education property tax and the low and moderate income homeowners property tax relief program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of revenue administration to receive the revenues from the state education property tax and deposit them in the education trust fund, and revises the procedures for calculating state education grants.  The bill modifies the criteria for relief under the low and moderate income homeowners property tax relief program, and establishes a committee to study the low and moderate income homeowners property tax relief program.

BillTitle: allowing voters to vote for multiple candidates for an office.
BillAnalysis: This bill eliminates statutory restrictions on the ability of voters to vote for multiple candidates for the same office.

BillTitle: relative to equal access to places of public accommodation.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires equal access to public accommodations for persons who have declined medical treatments or use of medical devices.
